channel.title: Computer_vision on Yerbol Aussat
channel.description: Recent content in Computer_vision on Yerbol Aussat

item.title: Book-AR: Augmented Reality for Books on a Bookshelf
item.description: See Report See Code Retrieving information about books on a bookshelf by simply pointing a camera at them could make the library and book- store browsing experience more convenient and effective. This paper presents Book-AR, an interactive real-time augmented reality (AR) system that augments books while they are on a bookshelf. Our system recognizes a desired book by its spine, and displays an AR menu with relevant book information, such as genre, ratings, prices and similar books.

item.title: Dog Breed Identification
item.description: See Report See Code In this project we attempted to build a classifier capable of identifying a dog’s breed based on its photo. Considering that on a high level dogs of different breeds can look very similar, it is a challenging task even for humans. To train and evaluate the model the “Columbia Dogs with Parts” dataset, containing 8,351 real-world images of 133 dog breeds, was used. The number of photos per breed ranged from 33 to 96.

item.title: Fingertip and Hand Tracking
item.description: My implementation of k-curvature algorithm for hand and fingertip tracking. See Slides See Code

item.title: Mimic-Emoji Game
item.description: Mimic-Emoji is a game in which a player’s goal is to mimic different emoji faces that appear onscreen. If a player successfully mimics an emoji face, he earns a score, and the guessed emoji face is augmented on the player’s face. This game uses Microsoft Emotion API that takes a facial expression in an image as an input, and returns the confidence across a set of emotions for each face in the image.
